The TWinSparkle type exposes the following members.

Constructors
Show:
 NameDescription
Create

Overloaded. Initializes a new instance of the TWinSparkle class.

Create(string)

Overloaded. Creates a new class and passes the full path of the DLL. If newPath is empty, the DLL path is the directory of the executable

Destroy

Represents the destructor of the TWinSparkle class.

Properties
Show:
 NameDescription
AppBuildVersion

Represents property AppBuildVersion.

AppcastURL

This property defines the full URL path for the appcast xml file.

AutoCheckForUpdates

Represents property AutoCheckForUpdates.

DLLLoaded

Checks if the DLL is loaded.

DLLPath

The path of the DLL.

LastCheckTime

Represents property LastCheckTime.

OnCanShutDown

Represents property OnCanShutDown.

OnDidFindUpdate

This event is triggered when an update is found.

OnDidNotFindUpdate

This event is triggered when an update is not found.

OnError

This event is triggered when WinSparkle gets an error while it is attempting to check for updates.

OnShutDown

This event is called when the updater closes and the install file is launched.

OnUpdateCancelled

This event is raised when the user closes the window or does not install the update ("Skip/Remind Later").

RegistryPath

Represents property RegistryPath.

UpdateCheckInterval

Represents property UpdateCheckInterval.

Top
Methods
Show:
 NameDescription
CheckUpdate(TUpdateType)

Calls the appropriate check update method depending on the updateType.

CheckUpdateWithoutUI

Doesn't show the window with the release notes. It just downloads the file and executes it.

CheckUpdateWithUI

Show a window with release notes and provides choices before downloading the updates.

CheckUpdateWithUIandInstall

Same as CheckUpdateWithUI but installs automatically the downloaded file.

Cleanup

Represents method Cleanup.

Init

Initialises WinSparkle.

ResetUpdateCheckInterval

Resets the check interval to the default value (86400 secs)

SetAppDetails(string,string,string)

Sets the application details.

SetLang(string)

Sets the language of the UI.

SetLangID(ShortInt)

Sets the language using the LanguageID.
